title.narrative: 1.3 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) PLAN AND FINANCE STRATEGY

description.narrative: By 2017, a National Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme and finance strategy are formulated, approved and regularly monitored to improve equitable access, gender sensitivity, sustainability, and efficiency of the sector, which contributes to Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, national policies, legislation, plans, budgets, coordination and monitoring mechanisms are enabling the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents, and women, to be fulfilled with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

participating-org.narrative: EKDARA GA PA GA KA PA OFFICE

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, a National WASH programme and finance strategy are formulated, approved and regularly monitored to improve equitableaccess, gender sensitivity, sustainability, and efficiency of the sector

description.narrative: Nepal WASH sector has been smoothly moving towards aligning with the new state restructuring process and refining its approaches and commitment for achieving the universal goals for safe water and sanitation for all by 2030 | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Annual Gender budget analysis commissioned

actual.value: 2017:A study on WASH Gender Responsive Budget 2016-2017 has been finalised.

title.narrative: % coverage (improved sanitation) for the lowest quintile

baseline.value: 26% (as per wealth quintile analysis of JMP 2012)

title.narrative: Annual Joint WASH Sector planning and review mechanism institutionalised and is gender sensitive

target.value: 2017:Minimum one Annual Review and one Planning Meeting held, synchronized with budget calendar, ensuring inputs from women and disadvantaged groups.

actual.value: 2017:The meeting was postponed until mid January 2018. But, preparatory work for WASH Sector stakeholder meeting planned is on track.
